page.title: 11North Anston
page.content: {North Anston}is a village in{South {Yorkshire}which is 12 miles from Sheffield and 6 miles from Worksop. Most of the Anston area is farmland and there are still farms in the village. The boundary between North Anston and South Anston is Anston Brook but the A57 road leading to Worksop and Sheffield is often mistaken for the boundary. To the north is{Dinnington}to which most of the population of Anston go shopping.{ {Dinnington Colliery}employs people from Anston as well as the surrounding district. Permian Magnesian Limestone used to be quarried in Anston and some of the stone was used to build the Houses of Parliament. Most of the older cottages were built from the local limestone. Housing estates were built in the 1950s and 1960s but many new houses are still being built.
